featured.text: The name comes from the sound the sandals make when they slap the walking feet.
It consists of a piece of rubber, plastic, leather, or woven material in the outline of a foot, with a strap holding the sandal to a wearer’s toes.
In the Greek version, the toe strap ran between the first and second toes, while Roman sandals had the strap between the second and third toes.
The innovative footwear resembles a common sandal and is made of leather straps and rubber soles, a material similar to that used in tires.
The sandals American soldiers brought home from Japan later became modern flip-flops.

other.text: Which of the following is true about the modern development of the flip-flop? (A) Modern flip-flops originated from Indian toe knob sandals.
Which culture most likely created the sandals shown in the picture? (A) Indian. (B) Greek.
In India, “toe knob” sandals had a knob between the first and second toes.
The sandals have subsequently undergone redesign, often appearing in bright colors in line with Californian beach culture.

definition.zh_def: 涼鞋，一種開放式的鞋子，通常由底部和帶子組成，適合在溫暖的天氣穿著。
definition.en_def: A type of open-toed footwear typically consisting of a sole held to the foot by straps or thongs.
definition.example: She wore her favorite sandals to the beach.
